page.title: 15SUMMER WALKS.
page.content: Summer walks are pleasant.During the hot summer mornings,me,my Dad,our Sam and when my Grandad comes on Sundays,all of us,go for long walks in the countryside.My favourite walk takes us from our house past the Jug and Glass pub,along Limes Avenue and on to the lane leading to Blue Barn Farm.When walking along this lane,we frequently see yellow hammers,goldfinches,pheasants,partridg es and kestrels,mice,hares and rabbits.After passing through the meadows near the farm we walk along the side of the potato fields to Langwith Lodge lake which has a wide variety of water birds.We often observe herons fishing,mallards bobbing,tufted ducks diving and the sudden brilliant blue flash of a startled kingfisher.Sometimes we call at the pub for welcome refreshments.
